definition: to fail to live up (to expectations)/unworthy (of trust)/to let down/to betray (hopes)/to disappoint
to bear/to carry (on one's back)/to turn one's back on/to be defeated/negative (math. etc)

sentences.english: The boy lived up to all his parents' expectations.
sentences.chinese: 這個男孩沒有辜負父母對他的期望。

sentences.english: Lion lived up to what readers expected of him.
sentences.chinese: 獅子從來不辜負讀者對他的期望。

sentences.english: We must never be unworthy of our teachers' untiring and sincere teachings.
sentences.chinese: 我們決不要辜負老師的諄諄教導。

sentences.english: Console them by saying stories cited as why the world mistreats them?
sentences.chinese: 用故事來安慰他們。就如，世界是怎樣辜負了他們？

sentences.english: I was crushed and felt I had failed the whole county.
sentences.chinese: 我備受打擊，感覺自己辜負了整個縣的民衆。

sentences.english: And actually I'm really fearful or I'm afraid that uh, and I, that I would let the people down.
sentences.chinese: 我現在非常地惶恐，就是怕辜負人民羣衆對我的期望。

sentences.english: He betrayed my trust in him.
sentences.chinese: 他辜負了我對他的信任。

sentences.english: To believe, each day the sun will not live up to their own smile.
sentences.chinese: 締要堅信，每一天的陽光都不會辜負自己的笑容。

sentences.english: Don't let down my cheer infatuation.
sentences.chinese: 不要辜負我的一片癡心。

sentences.english: The coffee beans are too good to be used by me.
sentences.chinese: 女侍應笑言怕自己辜負了上好的咖啡豆。

sentences.english: Our children do try to live up to our expectations.
sentences.chinese: 我們的孩子的確會努力以不辜負我們的期望。

sentences.english: I'll not abuse your hospitality, your kindness.
sentences.chinese: 我不會辜負你的熱情招待和好意。

sentences.english: The players failed to live up to their coach's expectations of them.
sentences.chinese: 選手們辜負了教練對他們的期望。

sentences.english: She could hold a grudge against anyone who betrayed her trust.
sentences.chinese: 如果任何人辜負了她的信任，她會怨恨的。

sentences.english: With all these fine characters, Lawyer Xu will never let his clients down.
sentences.chinese: 徐新明律師當不辜負委託人的信賴與重託。

sentences.english: I have let you down, and I have let down my fans.
sentences.chinese: 我讓你們失望了，我辜負了我的球迷。

definition: to grieve/to be broken-hearted/to feel deeply hurt
bosom/heart/mind/to think of/to harbor in one's mind/to conceive (a child)
to let off/to let slip by/to let sb get away with sth
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
reluctant to leave/to hate to have to go/to recall fondly
ten million/countless/many/one must by all means
to hug/to cherish/within the bosom (of the family)/to embrace (also fig. an ideal, aspiration etc)
to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
